channel.title: Problem running clients
channel.description: Ok, I just got windows 7, and when I run anyclient, I click a few times on the server, and my client just closes. Heres the error I get... [code]# # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000006d8ea566, pid=4688, t id=3488 # # JRE version: 6.0_18-b07 # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (16.0-b13 mixed mode windows-amd64 ) # Problematic frame: # V [jvm.dll+0x5a566] # # An error report file with more information is saved as: # C:\Users\Jake\Downloads\Final\client\hs_err_pid4688.log # # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp # Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: Problem running clients
item.dc:creator: @Final_Dawn Final Dawn
item.description:
@Final_Dawn wrote:

Hmm, now that I am reading the error that this guy posted, I am thinking that Java hasn’t even made a 64-Bit version, I am not 100% sure on this, I am going to take my brothers 64-bit and duel boot and check. I am not 100% sure tho.

Read full topic

item.description:
@shmidlap123 wrote:

Ok, I just got windows 7, and when I run anyclient, I click a few times on the server, and my client just closes.
Heres the error I get…

A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
